content.question:
A state claims that there is a linear relationship between the number of tollbooths open at the same time and the revenue generated by tolls. The state collected data and used the data to test the claim that there is a linear relationship at a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The state tested the following hypotheses.

<math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The test yielded a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.03. Which of the following is a correct conclusion about the state’s claim?

choices.label: The null hypothesis is rejected because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

The null hypothesis is not rejected because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

The null hypothesis is rejected because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

The null hypothesis is not rejected because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is not sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

The null hypothesis is accepted because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is not a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

content.answer: The null hypothesis is rejected because <math alttext="0.03 is less than 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.03</mn><mo><</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is sufficient evidence to suggest that there is a linear relationship between revenue and the number of tollbooths.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
